work.name: Kridel Lab, Princess Margaret Cancer Centre
University of Toronto Surgical Skills Centre
Division of Teaching Labs, University of Toronto
Department of Molecular Genetics, University of Toronto
Osmond Lab, University of Toronto
highlights: Modelled the evolution of diploid genomes in 2D space with SLiM simulation program.
Scripted in Python and Unix Shell to extract simulated genomic data and visualize coalescent trees.
Collaborated with lab members during weekly lab meetings and on Slack messaging platform to solve coding problems and share individual progress.
Proposed and organized the execution of a team project to generate a tree visualization tutorial for academics.

education.studyType: Master of Health Science in Medical Genomics
courses: **Select Coursework:** Advanced Human Genetics, Biological Statistics, Genomic Methodologies, Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis and Interpretation
Majors: Molecular Genetics and Microbiology, Cell and Molecular Biology

Select Coursework: Molecular & Cell Biology, General & Human Genetics, Practice of Statistics I, Bioinformatic Methods, Eukaryotic Gene Expression,  Principles of Genetic Analysis I, Introduction to Computer Programming, Genome Biology Lab, Regulation of Gene Expression, Functional Genomics, Genomic & Proteomic Methods, Human and Molecular Genetics
Extracurriculars: Science Writer for The Varsity, Member of the Global Society for Genetics and Genome Biology, Trinity College Applicant Profile Reviewer
